subject: DAKO
title: Into to Dakota Linguistics
info: structure of dakota, including phonology, morphology, syntax, and semantics.

title: Dakota Language for the Class
info: general/specialized language for core subjects, daily routines, and classroom discourse. methods for teaching dakota language.

info: dakota language for teachers. methods of teaching dakota language in the classroom.

subject: DAKO
title: Beg Dakota I
info: language acquisitions skills, oral drills. in-class participation focuses on questions/answers.

subject: DAKO
title: Beg Dakota II
info: further development of language acquisition skills. oral drills, in-class participation focused on questions and answers.
prereqInfo: [1121, 1004 in another language] or passing score on lpe or grad student

subject: DAKO
title: Intermediate Dakota I
info: listening, speaking, reading, writing. oral drills. in-class participation focuses on questions/answers.

subject: DAKO
title: Int Dakota II
info: listening, speaking, reading, writing. oral drills. in-class participation focuses on questions/answers.

subject: DAKO
title: Dakota Mastery I
info: this content-based dakota language class will focus on dakota culture and history. students will learn through both oral and written texts. both traditional and contemporary stories will be discussed and utilized to give students a better view of dakota ontology and epistemology. the effects of colonization and the need for decolonization will be also be discussed through the lens of dakota stories and culture.

subject: DAKO
title: Dakota Mastery II
info: this content-based dakota language class will focus on dakota culture and history. students will learn through both oral and written texts. both traditional and contemporary stories will be discussed and utilized to give students a better view of dakota ontology and epistemology. the effects of colonization and the need for decolonization will be also be discussed through the lens of dakota stories and culture.
